CheckInLicense.name: CheckInLicense
CheckInLicense.documentation: Checks in the specified license. Check in a license when it is no longer in use.

CheckoutBorrowLicense.name: CheckoutBorrowLicense
CheckoutBorrowLicense.documentation: Checks out the specified license for offline use.

CheckoutLicense.name: CheckoutLicense
CheckoutLicense.documentation:
Checks out the specified license.

If the account that created the license is the same that is performing the check out, you must specify the account as the beneficiary.

CreateGrant.name: CreateGrant
CreateGrant.documentation: Creates a grant for the specified license. A grant shares the use of license entitlements with a specific Amazon Web Services account, an organization, or an organizational unit (OU). For more information, see Granted licenses in License Manager in the License Manager User Guide.

CreateGrantVersion.name: CreateGrantVersion
CreateGrantVersion.documentation: Creates a new version of the specified grant. For more information, see Granted licenses in License Manager in the License Manager User Guide.

CreateLicenseConfiguration.name: CreateLicenseConfiguration
CreateLicenseConfiguration.documentation:
Creates a license configuration.

A license configuration is an abstraction of a customer license agreement that can be consumed and enforced by License Manager. Components include specifications for the license type (licensing by instance, socket, CPU, or vCPU), allowed tenancy (shared tenancy, Dedicated Instance, Dedicated Host, or all of these), license affinity to host (how long a license must be associated with a host), and the number of licenses purchased and used.

CreateLicenseVersion.name: CreateLicenseVersion
CreateLicenseVersion.documentation: Creates a new version of the specified license.

CreateToken.name: CreateToken
CreateToken.documentation:
Creates a long-lived token.

A refresh token is a JWT token used to get an access token. With an access token, you can call AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity to get role credentials that you can use to call License Manager to manage the specified license.

DeleteLicenseConfiguration.name: DeleteLicenseConfiguration
DeleteLicenseConfiguration.documentation:
Deletes the specified license configuration.

You cannot delete a license configuration that is in use.

DeleteLicenseManagerReportGenerator.name: DeleteLicenseManagerReportGenerator
DeleteLicenseManagerReportGenerator.documentation:
Deletes the specified report generator.

This action deletes the report generator, which stops it from generating future reports. The action cannot be reversed. It has no effect on the previous reports from this generator.

DeleteToken.name: DeleteToken
DeleteToken.documentation: Deletes the specified token. Must be called in the license home Region.

ExtendLicenseConsumption.name: ExtendLicenseConsumption
ExtendLicenseConsumption.documentation: Extends the expiration date for license consumption.

GetAccessToken.name: GetAccessToken
GetAccessToken.documentation: Gets a temporary access token to use with AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity. Access tokens are valid for one hour.

GetGrant.name: GetGrant
GetGrant.documentation: Gets detailed information about the specified grant.

GetLicense.name: GetLicense
GetLicense.documentation: Gets detailed information about the specified license.

GetLicenseConfiguration.name: GetLicenseConfiguration
GetLicenseConfiguration.documentation: Gets detailed information about the specified license configuration.

GetLicenseConversionTask.name: GetLicenseConversionTask
GetLicenseConversionTask.documentation: Gets information about the specified license type conversion task.

GetLicenseManagerReportGenerator.name: GetLicenseManagerReportGenerator
GetLicenseManagerReportGenerator.documentation: Gets information about the specified report generator.

GetLicenseUsage.name: GetLicenseUsage
GetLicenseUsage.documentation: Gets detailed information about the usage of the specified license.

GetServiceSettings.name: GetServiceSettings
GetServiceSettings.documentation: Gets the License Manager settings for the current Region.

ListAssociationsForLicenseConfiguration.name: ListAssociationsForLicenseConfiguration
ListAssociationsForLicenseConfiguration.documentation:
Lists the resource associations for the specified license configuration.

Resource associations need not consume licenses from a license configuration. For example, an AMI or a stopped instance might not consume a license (depending on the license rules).

ListDistributedGrants.name: ListDistributedGrants
ListDistributedGrants.documentation: Lists the grants distributed for the specified license.

ListFailuresForLicenseConfigurationOpera.name: ListFailuresForLicenseConfigurationOperations
ListFailuresForLicenseConfigurationOpera.documentation: Lists the license configuration operations that failed.

ListLicenseConfigurations.name: ListLicenseConfigurations
ListLicenseConfigurations.documentation: Lists the license configurations for your account.

ListLicenseConversionTasks.name: ListLicenseConversionTasks
ListLicenseConversionTasks.documentation: Lists the license type conversion tasks for your account.

ListLicenseManagerReportGenerators.name: ListLicenseManagerReportGenerators
ListLicenseManagerReportGenerators.documentation: Lists the report generators for your account.

ListLicenseSpecificationsForResource.name: ListLicenseSpecificationsForResource
ListLicenseSpecificationsForResource.documentation: Describes the license configurations for the specified resource.

ListLicenseVersions.name: ListLicenseVersions
ListLicenseVersions.documentation: Lists all versions of the specified license.

ListReceivedGrants.name: ListReceivedGrants
ListReceivedGrants.documentation: Lists grants that are received. Received grants are grants created while specifying the recipient as this Amazon Web Services account, your organization, or an organizational unit (OU) to which this member account belongs.

ListReceivedGrantsForOrganization.name: ListReceivedGrantsForOrganization
ListReceivedGrantsForOrganization.documentation: Lists the grants received for all accounts in the organization.

ListReceivedLicensesForOrganization.name: ListReceivedLicensesForOrganization
ListReceivedLicensesForOrganization.documentation: Lists the licenses received for all accounts in the organization.

ListResourceInventory.name: ListResourceInventory
ListResourceInventory.documentation: Lists resources managed using Systems Manager inventory.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags for the specified resource. For more information about tagging support in License Manager, see the TagResource operation.

ListUsageForLicenseConfiguration.name: ListUsageForLicenseConfiguration
ListUsageForLicenseConfiguration.documentation: Lists all license usage records for a license configuration, displaying license consumption details by resource at a selected point in time. Use this action to audit the current license consumption for any license inventory and configuration.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation:
Adds the specified tags to the specified resource. The following resources support tagging in License Manager:

  • Licenses

  • Grants

  • License configurations

  • Report generators

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.

UpdateLicenseConfiguration.name: UpdateLicenseConfiguration
UpdateLicenseConfiguration.documentation: Modifies the attributes of an existing license configuration.

UpdateLicenseManagerReportGenerator.name: UpdateLicenseManagerReportGenerator
UpdateLicenseManagerReportGenerator.documentation:
Updates a report generator.

After you make changes to a report generator, it starts generating new reports within 60 minutes of being updated.

UpdateLicenseSpecificationsForResource.name: UpdateLicenseSpecificationsForResource
UpdateLicenseSpecificationsForResource.documentation:
Adds or removes the specified license configurations for the specified Amazon Web Services resource.

You can update the license specifications of AMIs, instances, and hosts. You cannot update the license specifications for launch templates and CloudFormation templates, as they send license configurations to the operation that creates the resource.

UpdateServiceSettings.name: UpdateServiceSettings
UpdateServiceSettings.documentation: Updates License Manager settings for the current Region.

AuthorizationException.documentation: The Amazon Web Services user account does not have permission to perform the action. Check the IAM policy associated with this account.

MaxTimeToLiveInMinutes.documentation: Maximum time for the borrow configuration, in minutes.

LicenseArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license. The license must use the borrow consumption configuration.

Entitlements.documentation: License entitlements. Partial checkouts are not supported.

DigitalSignatureMethod.documentation: Digital signature method. The possible value is JSON Web Signature (JWS) algorithm PS384. For more information, see RFC 7518 Digital Signature with RSASSA-PSS.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

IssuedAt.documentation: Date and time at which the license checkout is issued.

Expiration.documentation: Date and time at which the license checkout expires.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

IssuedAt.documentation: Date and time at which the license checkout is issued.

Expiration.documentation: Date and time at which the license checkout expires.

LicenseArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the checkout license.

ConflictException.documentation: There was a conflict processing the request. Try your request again.

ResourceType.documentation: Resource type of the resource consuming a license.

ConsumedLicenses.documentation: Number of licenses consumed by the resource.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

Principals.documentation:
The grant principals. You can specify one of the following as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN):

  • An Amazon Web Services account, which includes only the account specified.

  • An organizational unit (OU), which includes all accounts in the OU.

  • An organization, which will include all accounts across your organization.

Tags.documentation: Tags to add to the grant. For more information about tagging support in License Manager, see the TagResource operation.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

LicenseCountingType.documentation: Dimension used to track the license inventory.

LicenseCount.documentation: Number of licenses managed by the license configuration.

LicenseCountHardLimit.documentation: Indicates whether hard or soft license enforcement is used. Exceeding a hard limit blocks the launch of new instances.

LicenseRules.documentation:
License rules. The syntax is #name=value (for example, #allowedTenancy=EC2-DedicatedHost). The available rules vary by dimension, as follows.

  • Cores dimension: allowedTenancy | licenseAffinityToHost | maximumCores | minimumCores

  • Instances dimension: allowedTenancy | maximumVcpus | minimumVcpus

  • Sockets dimension: allowedTenancy | licenseAffinityToHost | maximumSockets | minimumSockets

  • vCPUs dimension: allowedTenancy | honorVcpuOptimization | maximumVcpus | minimumVcpus

The unit for licenseAffinityToHost is days and the range is 1 to 180. The possible values for allowedTenancy are EC2-Default, EC2-DedicatedHost, and EC2-DedicatedInstance. The possible values for honorVcpuOptimization are True and False.

Tags.documentation: Tags to add to the license configuration.

DisassociateWhenNotFound.documentation: When true, disassociates a resource when software is uninstalled.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

ResourceArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource you are converting the license type for.

SourceLicenseContext.documentation: Information that identifies the license type you are converting from. For the structure of the source license, see Convert a license type using the CLI in the License Manager User Guide.

DestinationLicenseContext.documentation: Information that identifies the license type you are converting to. For the structure of the destination license, see Convert a license type using the CLI in the License Manager User Guide.

LicenseConversionTaskId.documentation: The ID of the created license type conversion task.

Type.documentation:
Type of reports to generate. The following report types an be generated:

  • License configuration report - Reports the number and details of consumed licenses for a license configuration.

  • Resource report - Reports the tracked licenses and resource consumption for a license configuration.

ReportContext.documentation: Defines the type of license configuration the report generator tracks.

ReportFrequency.documentation: Frequency by which reports are generated. Reports can be generated daily, monthly, or weekly.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

Tags.documentation: Tags to add to the report generator.

LicenseManagerReportGeneratorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the new report generator.

Validity.documentation: Date and time range during which the license is valid, in ISO8601-UTC format.

ConsumptionConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for consumption of the license. Choose a provisional configuration for workloads running with continuous connectivity. Choose a borrow configuration for workloads with offline usage.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

Tags.documentation: Tags to add to the license. For more information about tagging support in License Manager, see the TagResource operation.

Validity.documentation: Date and time range during which the license is valid, in ISO8601-UTC format.

ConsumptionConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for consumption of the license. Choose a provisional configuration for workloads running with continuous connectivity. Choose a borrow configuration for workloads with offline usage.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

LicenseArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license. The ARN is mapped to the aud claim of the JWT token.

RoleArns.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM roles to embed in the token. License Manager does not check whether the roles are in use.

ExpirationInDays.documentation: Token expiration, in days, counted from token creation. The default is 365 days.

TokenProperties.documentation: Data specified by the caller to be included in the JWT token. The data is mapped to the amr claim of the JWT token.

Token.documentation: Refresh token, encoded as a JWT token.

DatetimeRange.documentation: Describes a time range, in ISO8601-UTC format.

StatusReason.documentation: The Status reason for the delete request.

LicenseManagerReportGeneratorArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the report generator to be deleted.

Value.documentation: Entitlement resource. Use only if the unit is None.

MaxCount.documentation: Maximum entitlement count. Use if the unit is not None.

Entitlement.documentation: Describes a resource entitled for use with a license.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request. Provides an error response if you do not have the required permissions.

Expiration.documentation: Date and time at which the license consumption expires.

FailedDependencyException.documentation: A dependency required to run the API is missing.

Name.documentation: Name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

Values.documentation: The value of the filter, which is case-sensitive. You can only specify one value for the filter.

Filter.documentation: A filter name and value pair that is used to return more specific results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs.

FilterLimitExceededException.documentation: The request uses too many filters or too many filter values.

Token.documentation: Refresh token, encoded as a JWT token.

TokenProperties.documentation: Token properties to validate against those present in the JWT token.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

LicenseCountingType.documentation: Dimension for which the licenses are counted.

LicenseCountHardLimit.documentation: Sets the number of available licenses as a hard limit.

OwnerAccountId.documentation: Account ID of the owner of the license configuration.

ConsumedLicenseSummaryList.documentation: Summaries of the licenses consumed by resources.

DisassociateWhenNotFound.documentation: When true, disassociates a resource when software is uninstalled.

LicenseConversionTaskId.documentation: ID of the license type conversion task to retrieve information on.
ID of the license type conversion task.

ResourceArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the resources the license conversion task is associated with.

SourceLicenseContext.documentation: Information about the license type converted from.

DestinationLicenseContext.documentation: Information about the license type converted to.

StatusMessage.documentation: The status message for the conversion task.

Status.documentation: Status of the license type conversion task.

StartTime.documentation: Time at which the license type conversion task was started .

LicenseConversionTime.documentation: Amount of time to complete the license type conversion.

EndTime.documentation: Time at which the license type conversion task was completed.

LicenseManagerReportGeneratorArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the report generator.

ReportGenerator.documentation: A report generator that creates periodic reports about your license configurations.

S3BucketArn.documentation: Regional S3 bucket path for storing reports, license trail event data, discovery data, and so on.

SnsTopicArn.documentation: SNS topic configured to receive notifications from License Manager.

OrganizationConfiguration.documentation: Indicates whether Organizations is integrated with License Manager for cross-account discovery.

LicenseManagerResourceShareArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share. The License Manager management account provides member accounts with access to this share.

Validity.documentation: Date and time range during which the granted license is valid, in ISO8601-UTC format.

GrantedLicense.documentation: Describes a license that is granted to a grantee.

InvalidParameterValueException.documentation: One or more parameter values are not valid.

InvalidResourceStateException.documentation:
License Manager cannot allocate a license to a resource because of its state.

For example, you cannot allocate a license to an instance in the process of shutting down.

SignKey.documentation: Asymmetric KMS key from Key Management Service. The KMS key must have a key usage of sign and verify, and support the RSASSA-PSS SHA-256 signing algorithm.

Issuer.documentation: Details about the issuer of a license.

SignKey.documentation: Asymmetric KMS key from Key Management Service. The KMS key must have a key usage of sign and verify, and support the RSASSA-PSS SHA-256 signing algorithm.

IssuerDetails.documentation: Details associated with the issuer of a license.

Validity.documentation: Date and time range during which the license is valid, in ISO8601-UTC format.

License.documentation: Software license that is managed in License Manager.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

LicenseCountingType.documentation: Dimension to use to track the license inventory.

LicenseCount.documentation: Number of licenses managed by the license configuration.

LicenseCountHardLimit.documentation: Number of available licenses as a hard limit.

DisassociateWhenNotFound.documentation: When true, disassociates a resource when software is uninstalled.

OwnerAccountId.documentation: Account ID of the license configuration's owner.

ConsumedLicenseSummaryList.documentation: Summaries for licenses consumed by various resources.

LicenseConfiguration.documentation: A license configuration is an abstraction of a customer license agreement that can be consumed and enforced by License Manager. Components include specifications for the license type (licensing by instance, socket, CPU, or vCPU), allowed tenancy (shared tenancy, Dedicated Instance, Dedicated Host, or all of these), host affinity (how long a VM must be associated with a host), and the number of licenses purchased and used.

ResourceOwnerId.documentation: ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource consuming licenses.

AssociationTime.documentation: Time when the license configuration was associated with the resource.

AmiAssociationScope.documentation: Scope of AMI associations. The possible value is cross-account.

LicenseConfigurationAssociation.documentation: Describes an association with a license configuration.

ResourceOwnerId.documentation: ID of the account that owns the resource.

AssociationTime.documentation: Time when the license configuration was initially associated with the resource.

ConsumedLicenses.documentation: Number of licenses consumed by the resource.

LicenseConfigurationUsage.documentation: Details about the usage of a resource associated with a license configuration.

UsageOperation.documentation: The Usage operation value that corresponds to the license type you are converting your resource from. For more information about which platforms correspond to which usage operation values see Sample data: usage operation by platform

ProductCodes.documentation: Product codes referred to in the license conversion process.

LicenseConversionContext.documentation: Information about a license type conversion task.

LicenseConversionTaskId.documentation: The ID of the license type conversion task.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the license type conversion task.

SourceLicenseContext.documentation: Information about the license type this conversion task converted from.

DestinationLicenseContext.documentation: Information about the license type this conversion task converted to.

StatusMessage.documentation: The status message for the conversion task.

StartTime.documentation: The time the conversion task was started at.

LicenseConversionTime.documentation: The time the usage operation value of the resource was changed.

EndTime.documentation: The time the conversion task was completed.

LicenseConversionTask.documentation: Information about a license type conversion task.

ResourceOwnerId.documentation: ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.

LicenseOperationFailure.documentation: Describes the failure of a license operation.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

AmiAssociationScope.documentation: Scope of AMI associations. The possible value is cross-account.

LicenseSpecification.documentation: Details for associating a license configuration with a resource.

LicenseUsage.documentation: Describes the entitlement usage associated with a license.

LicenseUsageException.documentation: You do not have enough licenses available to support a new resource launch.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a license configuration.

MaxResults.documentation: Maximum number of results to return in a single call.

NextToken.documentation: Token for the next set of results.

LicenseConfigurationAssociations.documentation: Information about the associations for the license configuration.

Filters to scope the results. The following filters are supported:

  • LicenseArn

  • GrantStatus

  • GranteePrincipalARN

  • ProductSKU

  • LicenseIssuerName

  • enforceLicenseCount - A Boolean value that indicates whether hard license enforcement is used.

  • usagelimitExceeded - A Boolean value that indicates whether the available licenses have been exceeded.

Filters.documentation:
Filters to scope the results. The following filters and logical operators are supported:

  • account_id - The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource. Logical operators are EQUALS | NOT_EQUALS.

  • application_name - The name of the application. Logical operators are EQUALS | BEGINS_WITH.

  • license_included - The type of license included. Logical operators are EQUALS | NOT_EQUALS. Possible values are sql-server-enterprise | sql-server-standard | sql-server-web | windows-server-datacenter.

  • platform - The platform of the resource. Logical operators are EQUALS | BEGINS_WITH.

  • resource_id - The ID of the resource. Logical operators are EQUALS | NOT_EQUALS.

  • tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Logical operators are EQUALS (single account) or EQUALS | NOT_EQUALS (cross account).

Filters.documentation:
Filters to scope the results. The following filters and logical operators are supported:

  • resourceArn - The ARN of the license configuration resource.

  • resourceType - The resource type (EC2_INSTANCE | EC2_HOST | EC2_AMI | SYSTEMS_MANAGER_MANAGED_INSTANCE).

  • resourceAccount - The ID of the account that owns the resource.

NextToken.documentation: Token for the next set of results.

ResourceType.documentation: Type of resource associated with a license.

NoEntitlementsAllowedException.documentation: There are no entitlements found for this license, or the entitlement maximum count is reached.

ActivationOverrideBehavior.documentation:
An activation option for your grant that determines the behavior of activating a grant. Activation options can only be used with granted licenses sourced from the Amazon Web Services Marketplace. Additionally, the operation must specify the value of ACTIVE for the Status parameter.

  • As a license administrator, you can optionally specify an ActivationOverrideBehavior when activating a grant.

  • As a grantor, you can optionally specify an ActivationOverrideBehavior when you activate a grant for a grantee account in your organization.

  • As a grantee, if the grantor creating the distributed grant doesnt specify an ActivationOverrideBehavior, you can optionally specify one when you are activating the grant.

DISTRIBUTED_GRANTS_ONLY

Use this value to activate a grant without replacing any member accounts active grants for the same product.

ALL_GRANTS_PERMITTED_BY_ISSUER

Use this value to activate a grant and disable other active grants in any member accounts for the same product. This action will also replace their previously activated grants with this activated grant.

Options.documentation: The options you can specify when you create a new version of a grant, such as activation override behavior. For more information, see Granted licenses in License Manager in the License Manager User Guide.

ProductCodeListItem.documentation: A list item that contains a product code.

ProductInformationFilterList.documentation:
A Product information filter consists of a ProductInformationFilterComparator which is a logical operator, a ProductInformationFilterName which specifies the type of filter being declared, and a ProductInformationFilterValue that specifies the value to filter on.

Accepted values for ProductInformationFilterName are listed here along with descriptions and valid options for ProductInformationFilterComparator.

The following filters and are supported when the resource type is SSM_MANAGED:

  • Application Name - The name of the application. Logical operator is EQUALS.

  • Application Publisher - The publisher of the application. Logical operator is EQUALS.

  • Application Version - The version of the application. Logical operator is EQUALS.

  • Platform Name - The name of the platform. Logical operator is EQUALS.

  • Platform Type - The platform type. Logical operator is EQUALS.

  • Tag:key - The key of a tag attached to an Amazon Web Services resource you wish to exclude from automated discovery. Logical operator is NOT_EQUALS. The key for your tag must be appended to Tag: following the example: Tag:name-of-your-key. ProductInformationFilterValue is optional if you are not using values for the key.

  • AccountId - The 12-digit ID of an Amazon Web Services account you wish to exclude from automated discovery. Logical operator is NOT_EQUALS.

  • License Included - The type of license included. Logical operators are EQUALS and NOT_EQUALS. Possible values are: sql-server-enterprise | sql-server-standard | sql-server-web | windows-server-datacenter.

The following filters and logical operators are supported when the resource type is RDS:

  • Engine Edition - The edition of the database engine. Logical operator is EQUALS. Possible values are: oracle-ee | oracle-se | oracle-se1 | oracle-se2 | db2-se | db2-ae.

  • License Pack - The license pack. Logical operator is EQUALS. Possible values are: data guard | diagnostic pack sqlt | tuning pack sqlt | ols | olap.

ProductInformation.documentation: Describes product information for a license configuration.

MaxTimeToLiveInMinutes.documentation: Maximum time for the provisional configuration, in minutes.

RateLimitExceededException.documentation: Too many requests have been submitted. Try again after a brief wait.

ReceivedMetadata.documentation: Metadata associated with received licenses and grants.

RedirectException.documentation: This is not the correct Region for the resource. Try again.

licenseConfigurationArns.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration that this generator reports on.

ReportContext.documentation: Details of the license configuration that this generator reports on.

value.documentation: Number of times within the frequency period that a report is generated. The only supported value is 1.

period.documentation: Time period between each report. The period can be daily, weekly, or monthly.

ReportFrequency.documentation: Details about how frequently reports are generated.
Details about how frequently reports are generated.

LicenseManagerReportGeneratorArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the report generator.

LastRunStatus.documentation: Status of the last report generation attempt.

LastRunFailureReason.documentation: Failure message for the last report generation attempt.

LastReportGenerationTime.documentation: Time the last report was generated at.

ReportCreatorAccount.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID used to create the report generator.

S3Location.documentation: Details of the S3 bucket that report generator reports are published to.

ReportGenerator.documentation: Describe the details of a report generator.

PlatformVersion.documentation: Platform version of the resource in the inventory.

ResourceOwningAccountId.documentation: ID of the account that owns the resource.

bucket.documentation: Name of the S3 bucket reports are published to.

keyPrefix.documentation: Prefix of the S3 bucket reports are published to.

S3Location.documentation: Details of the S3 bucket that report generator reports are published to.

ServerInternalException.documentation: The server experienced an internal error. Try again.

Tag.documentation: Details about the tags for a resource. For more information about tagging support in License Manager, see the TagResource operation.

ResourceArn.documentation:
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. The following examples provide an example ARN for each supported resource in License Manager:

  • Licenses - arn:aws:license-manager::111122223333:license:l-EXAMPLE2da7646d6861033667f20e895

  • Grants - arn:aws:license-manager::111122223333:grant:g-EXAMPLE7b19f4a0ab73679b0beb52707

  • License configurations - arn:aws:license-manager:us-east-1:111122223333:license-configuration:lic-EXAMPLE6a788d4c8acd4264ff0ecf2ed2d

  • Report generators - arn:aws:license-manager:us-east-1:111122223333:report-generator:r-EXAMPLE825b4a4f8fe5a3e0c88824e5fc6

TokenType.documentation: Type of token generated. The supported value is REFRESH_TOKEN.

RoleArns.documentation: Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the roles included in the token.

Status.documentation: Token status. The possible values are AVAILABLE and DELETED.

UnsupportedDigitalSignatureMethodExcepti.documentation: The digital signature method is unsupported. Try your request again.

LicenseConfigurationArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

LicenseRules.documentation: New license rule. The only rule that you can add after you create a license configuration is licenseAffinityToHost.

LicenseCount.documentation: New number of licenses managed by the license configuration.

LicenseCountHardLimit.documentation: New hard limit of the number of available licenses.

DisassociateWhenNotFound.documentation: When true, disassociates a resource when software is uninstalled.

LicenseManagerReportGeneratorArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the report generator to update.

Type.documentation:
Type of reports to generate. The following report types are supported:

  • License configuration report - Reports the number and details of consumed licenses for a license configuration.

  • Resource report - Reports the tracked licenses and resource consumption for a license configuration.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

ResourceArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services resource.

AddLicenseSpecifications.documentation: ARNs of the license configurations to add.

RemoveLicenseSpecifications.documentation: ARNs of the license configurations to remove.

S3BucketArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 bucket where the License Manager information is stored.

SnsTopicArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used for License Manager alerts.

OrganizationConfiguration.documentation: Enables integration with Organizations for cross-account discovery.

ValidationException.documentation: The provided input is not valid. Try your request again.

documentation: License Manager makes it easier to manage licenses from software vendors across multiple Amazon Web Services accounts and on-premises servers.
